    Transforming Covariates

    2017-11-14

    Supported transformations

    For convenience, you may wish to transform one or more of your covariates within the model estimation call. For example, imagine we want to natural log transform the variable dist in a linear regression:

    cars <- transform(cars, dist.log = log(dist))
    

    m.log <- lm(speed ~ log(dist), data = cars)
    

    m.log2 <- lm(speed ~ dist.log, data = cars)

    Then we want to find quantities of interest when the dist variable is 26 to 56 (the first to third quartile):

    
library(smargins)
    

    

    
summary(smargins(m.log, at = list(dist = c(26, 56))))
    ##   dist     mean        sd   median lower_2.5 upper_97.5
## 1   26 13.87662 0.4526467 13.88076  13.03815   14.81129
## 2   56 18.14537 0.5168486 18.13301  17.14713   19.15717

    We could also estimate the model with dist as a polynomial. For example:

    # Find range of polynomial values
    

    

    m2 <- lm(speed ~ poly(dist, 2), data = cars)
    

    
summary(smargins(m2, at = list(dist = with(cars, seq(min(dist), max(dist), 10)))))
    ##    dist     mean        sd   median lower_2.5 upper_97.5
## 1     2 12.79869 0.5022219 12.80126  11.82484   13.78957
## 2    12 13.49868 0.4534586 13.50681  12.60881   14.42024
## 3    22 14.12944 0.4316310 14.12905  13.30511   14.99000
## 4    32 14.69097 0.4265784 14.69548  13.87089   15.52874
## 5    42 15.18328 0.4283250 15.20087  14.34898   16.01646
## 6    52 15.60637 0.4298561 15.62255  14.76988   16.45221
## 7    62 15.96022 0.4278413 15.97347  15.13318   16.80495
## 8    72 16.24486 0.4225641 16.25439  15.43314   17.07150
## 9    82 16.46027 0.4180204 16.46449  15.64083   17.26420
## 10   92 16.60645 0.4220941 16.59778  15.79501   17.39687
## 11  102 16.68341 0.4455857 16.67147  15.79415   17.53647
## 12  112 16.69114 0.4987534 16.68240  15.66763   17.62858

    Splines and other transformations should generally work as expected.

    
library(splines)
    

    

    m3 <- lm(speed ~ bs(dist, df = 4), data = cars)
    

    
summary(smargins(m3, at = list(dist = with(cars, seq(min(dist), max(dist), 10)))))
    ##    dist      mean        sd    median  lower_2.5 upper_97.5
## 1     2  4.741302 2.1248232  4.696211  0.7368938   8.834085
## 2    12  7.332929 1.0666730  7.336530  5.2303327   9.407434
## 3    22 10.123343 0.6700139 10.113275  8.8593720  11.400851
## 4    32 12.900883 0.5191993 12.895081 11.8365490  13.878183
## 5    42 15.453886 0.5775169 15.452164 14.3181335  16.564273
## 6    52 17.570689 0.7090125 17.587626 16.2035909  18.955678
## 7    62 19.051249 0.7096018 19.044171 17.6748580  20.495267
## 8    72 19.962793 0.8835377 19.957035 18.2710222  21.719067
## 9    82 20.639816 1.2722055 20.621641 18.1538608  23.078248
## 10   92 21.428435 1.4779320 21.471026 18.5120367  24.133535
## 11  102 22.674765 1.5747419 22.712246 19.6217812  25.702596
## 12  112 24.724922 2.8621782 24.722269 19.1992823  30.050447
